original_solution_mapping.L1: Marie will read 20 but gain 6 unread messages a day, so she will lower the number of messages by 20 - 6 = <<20-6=14>>14.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Thus, it will take her 98 / 14 = <<98/14=7>>7 days to read all her unread messages.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6698.
    Returns: the number of days it will take to read all unread messages.
    """
    # L1
    messages_read_per_day = 20 # reading 20 messages a day
    new_messages_per_day = 6 # gets 6 new messages a day
    net_messages_cleared_per_day = messages_read_per_day - new_messages_per_day

    # L2
    initial_unread_messages = 98 # 98 unread messages
    days_to_clear_messages = initial_unread_messages / net_messages_cleared_per_day

    # FA
    answer = days_to_clear_messages
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Marie will read {messages_read_per_day} but gain {new_messages_per_day} unread messages a day, so she will lower the number of messages by {messages_read_per_day} - {new_messages_per_day} = <<{messages_read_per_day}-{new_messages_per_day}={net_messages_cleared_per_day}>>{net_messages_cleared_per_day}.

Thus, it will take her {initial_unread_messages} / {net_messages_cleared_per_day} = <<{initial_unread_messages}/{net_messages_cleared_per_day}={days_to_clear_messages}>>{days_to_clear_messages} days to read all her unread messages.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Marie will read 20 but gain 6 unread messages a day, so she will lower the number of messages by 20 - 6 = <<20-6=14>>14.

explanation: Incorrect final answer. An intermediate value 'net_messages_cleared_per_day' (value: 14) was reported instead of 'days_to_clear_messages' (value: 7.0).
